title: What Twitter option prevents others from retweeting my tweets? I'm asking because I noticed some people I follow have their retweet button disabled yet there doesn't seem to be an option for it in my settings. - Quora

response.answer_text: In your Privacy and Safety settings, the first checkbox labeled ‘Protect your Tweets’ prevents your Tweets from being shared publicly. When checked:  Followers can view your Tweets but cannot Retweet themNon-followers can neither view nor Retweet your TweetsUsers with this setting enabled can be identified by the padlock symbol displayed next to their name.
If there's an icon that looks like a lock on the right of their handle, their account is on protected setting.
